message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the problem of merging coreference annotations obtained from multiple annotators into a single gold standard. This problem is related to natural language processing and machine learning, which are covered by the arXiv categories cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of Answer Set Programming to describe the problem and the optimization criteria suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the arXiv category cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves the use of linguistic hard constraints, which may be of interest to researchers in the arXiv categories cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CY (Computers and Society).
